derivation: from an unused root meaning to sever;
outline:
1. midst, middle
    1. midst, middle
    2. into, through (after verbs of motion)
    3. among (of a number of persons)
    4. between (of things arranged by twos)
    5. from among (as to take or separate etc)
kjv_def: among(-st), [idiom] between, half, [idiom] (there-, where-), in(-to), middle, mid(-night), midst (among), [idiom] out (of), [idiom] through, [idiom] with(-in).
strongs_def: a bisection, i.e. (by implication) the centre
